result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas L Gonzales was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AODA  Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No use or possession of or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA Sample, if not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

Cash Bail Applied to Buy Money.  Remaining Buy Money/Costs/Surcharges to be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $50.00 per month starting 12-01-2015.  Buy Money to be paid prior to Costs and Surcharges.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  6 Months Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions - Defendant to report to Huber by noon on 05-08-2015.  Court Grants Good Time.
Each year of Probation with Community Service in the last year to be completed by the 10th Month of the Last Year.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lucas L Gonzales in court with attorney Nicholas K. Martinez.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing argument by the State and Atty. Martinez.

The Court Orders the Following:

COUNT 1

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

3 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days )
- 1 Years of Initial Confinement
- 2 Years of Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: 3 Years

Conditions of Probation:
- AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- No Use or Possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
- No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
- Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed;
- Inform agent of all prescriptions;
- Sign Medical Release for Agent;
- Perform  20 hours of community service each year of probation with community service in the last year to be completed by the 10th month of the last year;
- Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Drivers License;
- Maintain/Obtain full time employment;
- Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge

Buy Money: State has 7 days to submit and updated statement.  Defense has 7 days to respond.  BAIL TO APPLY. To be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 12-1-15  To be paid prior to costs.

Costs: $268.00 
DNA Surcharge:  $250.00

Condition Time: 6 months Huber NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - Defendant to report to Huber by noon on 5-8-15.  Court grants good time.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program


COUNT 4

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

6 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days )  CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 1
- 3 Years of Initial Confinement
- 3 Years of Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: 3 Years  CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1

Conditions of Probation:  Same as Count 1

Buy Money: State has 7 days to submit and updated statement.  Defense has 7 days to respond.  BAIL TO APPLY. To be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 12-1-15  To be paid prior to costs.

Costs: $268.00 
DNA Surcharge:  $250.00

Costs and Surcharges to be paid as a condition of probation at the rate of $75.00  per month commencing 12-1-15 and/or 104 hours of community service to be completed by the end of probation.  Court must receive notice of completion prior to due date. 

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
